intro: Lappula echinophora var. sessilis, commonly known as the sessile lappula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a short life cycle and is often considered a weed in agricultural areas. The sessile lappula is known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
